_header: Madame a trouth not wot I what to say
_description:
An absent lover, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 59) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and 4-line Envoy (abab)

BLHar682.First Lines:
MAdame a trouthe not wot y what to sayNor bi what ende that y
                    shulde first bigynne…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…That more y lust to wayle then laughe or grenSyn hit is so
                    that y am from yow fare
